videos.title: 5 BCBA Ethics Questions That Trip Everyone Up
videos.description: Most people get question #3 wrong on the BCBA exam—and it costs them. Learn the 5 ethics traps that separate those who pass from those who don't, with real-world scenarios and surprising correct answers.
videos.metaDescription: Master 5 common BCBA ethics questions that trip up most exam candidates. Learn the surprising correct answers with real-world scenarios from an experienced school BCBA.

videos.title: Reinforcement vs Punishment: The Question That Separates Passers from Failers
videos.description: If you can't nail the 2x2 matrix in under 10 seconds, you're not ready for the BCBA exam. Deep dive into positive/negative reinforcement/punishment with tricky examples that show up in 15-20 exam questions.
videos.metaDescription: Master the reinforcement vs punishment matrix that appears in 15-20 BCBA exam questions. Learn the 2-question decision tree that prevents common mistakes.

videos.title: Experimental Design Made Simple: The 3 Things You MUST Know
videos.description: Experimental design sounds complicated—but the BCBA exam only cares about three things. Master reversal, multiple baseline, and multielement designs and ace every single-subject design question.
videos.metaDescription: Simplify BCBA experimental design with 3 core concepts: reversal, multiple baseline, and multielement designs. Learn when to use each for your exam and practice.

videos.title: From FBA to BIP in 10 Minutes: A School BCBA's Guide
videos.description: I've written over 200 behavior plans in schools, and I can get from FBA to BIP in about 10 minutes. Learn the exact framework used by a school-based BCBA to create effective, function-based behavior plans.
videos.metaDescription: Create function-based behavior plans in 10 minutes with this proven 6-step framework used by school BCBAs. From FBA hypothesis to BIP implementation.

videos.title: How to Actually Pass the BCBA Exam: A Study Strategy That Works
videos.description: If you're reading the same chapter for the third time and still don't feel ready, you're studying wrong. Learn the evidence-based study strategy that actually works: active recall, spaced repetition, and deliberate practice.
videos.metaDescription: Stop re-reading and start learning with this evidence-based BCBA exam study strategy. Active recall, spaced repetition, and timed practice for first-time passers.
